conversations.content: All right, everybody! One more time! HAAAAPPY NEW YEAR!
HAPPY NEW YEAR!
I find myself growing used to this little custom of ours. It feels good to cry out such things to ring in a new year.
Ever since Ieyasu taught us about it, New Year's has become the event ain't NOBODY wants to miss!
Probably because of all the food, which makes it the BEST holiday!
I had Mitsuba teach me how to make an authentic Hinomotoan New Year's meal, so please eat to your hearts' content.
So I love you, Cleo, and your cooking is hotter than a flaming rock in a catapult... but right now I just wanna play some New Year's games!
That's a great idea, Notte! We could play hanetsuki, fly some kites, spin tops... Oh, or even try that Hinomotoan poetry game again!
We've learned so many things now, so what do you want to play?
Y'know, now that you actually put it to me, I'm kinda stuck. I mean, we've done all those already, you know?
They're super fun and all, but there's just no surprise to 'em anymore. No OOMPH. That's a word, right? Oomph?
Howdy, pardners! Y'all mind if we crash this here hootenanny with ya?
Is that you, Kuzunoha?
Sure as shootin'! It's been a hot minute, huh? Hope y'all are havin' a real swell New Year.
Assistant to Seimei, Leader of the Ox Clan Kuzunoha
It appears you have already begun your New Year's feast.
Onmyoji and Leader of the Ox Clan Seimei
Ohmigosh, it's Kuzunoha AND Seimei! Oh man, this is so great! ...Er, but wait. What are you doing here?
We had some business 'round these parts, so Lord Seimei said we outta pop in and say yee-haw.
This was SEIMEI'S idea? Wow. I figured he would view this kind of thing as a big ol' pain in the... Well, as a pain.
Oh, normally he ain't much for shindigs and whatnot, but he makes himself a right special exception for New Year's.
He always had himself a real humdinger of a time spendin' New Year's with his late grandpappy, so now he cherishes it.
Yes, I remember how much care he took running the tournament last year, as well as planning the banquet.
Right ya are! So anyway, he was wonderin' what y'all were gettin' up to—YEOWCH!
You're running your mouth, stupid fox. ...Yes, well, that's enough out of her. Are you all enjoying the New Year?
Heck yeah we are! There's tons of food, and we were just talking about what game to play. Er, but...
Yes? What is it?
We're kinda used to all the games we've learned, so they may be a little lacking in excitement, you know?
Hey, do YOU guys know any other games?! I wanna try something like nothing we've tried before!
Ya want somethin' that'll knock your socks off in a brand new way?
Well, hold on to yer slop buckets, 'cause I got me a whopper of a game!
Ooo, tell me, tell me!
It's m'own special-made, real-life sugoroku board game! TAAA-DAAAAH!
Uh...that just looks like a box.
That IS what it looks like, ain't it? But it's actually a special game set I made with one'a Lord Seimei's spells.
I knew Lord Seimei wanted everyone to have an extra-special New Year's, so I made it happen with this here game.
This lil' feller is a heap'a fun no matter how many times ya play it! And I know, 'cause I used my whole holiday to make it.
You wasted your entire holiday making that...thing?
I sure as heck did—and I guarantee ya won't have fun like this nowhere else! So whatcha say? Interested?
I sure am! But, um...if I remember how sugoroku works, I can't just play it by myself, right?
I'd love to give it a shot if that's all right. Does anyone else want in?
The more the merrier is usually the rule of thumb for any game, so count me in.
If my ol' pranking buddy Kuzunoha is involved, you KNOW I ain't missing this!
And it ain't a party OR a game until Ranzal shows up, so consider Ranzal showed!
I would like to join as well. Is it possible to play this particular game with six?
Heck yeah, it is! Y'all get ready and enjoy yerselves, and I'll be out here cheerin' ya on the whole durn way!
Uh, did she just say ＂out here＂?
Right then! Lemme just make the six of ya the target of this here spell...
O that which glimmers as the moon! May yer light become joy and open the gate to the world of dreams! ONMYO!
Huh? Wait, I'm getting sucked in! Noooooo, I don't wanna play anymooore!
Nnngh... Wh-what just happened?
No idea. You guys okay?
I think we're fine, Notte—I'm honestly more concerned with the ground.
The ground? ...Oh, I see! It reads ＂START＂ there in some very flashy colors.
There's squares as far as the eye can see, and they all have stuff written on 'em.
But that means this place is...
You bet yer sweet bippy it is! Y'all are standin' in the world of my real-life sugoroku board game!
AAAHHH! KUZUNOHA'S IN THE SKY! Is THIS what you meant when you said it was ＂real life＂?!
I meant y'all were gonna be the pieces! For this game, ya gotta make yer way through the world and have yerself some real-life experiences.
Oh, but don't get yer overalls in a bunch, 'cause I made sure there was a way for y'all to all come home. Lemme show ya!
GAAAAAH! IT'S THAT LIGHT AGAIN!
Huh? Wait, it's gone.
Well, cow plop! That ain't how it's supposed to go! I coulda sworn I did that there spell right. Unless... OH NO!
So, um, I'm right sorry 'bout this, y'all, but I sorta screwed up the spell, which means ya can't leave unless ya go and beat the game.
You mean we're TRAPPED in here?!
Yeah, and I'm real sorry about it! If ya manage to make it out alive, I'll definitely find a way what to make it up to ya.
Enough, you stupid fox. If all they have to do to escape is finish the game, then we will simply help them finish.
Right then, all of you. Hurry up and finish, then return here. If you need help, I will do whatever I can.
Okay, I feel WAY better knowing that Seimei's helping us, so let's go out there and beat this thing like a rug!
And, um, maybe we can have some fun while we're at it? Pretty please with literally everything on top of it?
Notte's right. It's not every day you get to play a game like this, so we might as well enjoy the experience.
See? He gets me. Now let's get this party started! Ready...set...GOOOO!
Braaaaaains...
NOOOOO, ZOMBIES ARE THE WOOOORST! SOMEBODY HAAAAAALP!
Do not lose heart, Notte! If you run but a little further, you will have satisfied the square's requirements!
I'm sick of steppin' on these weird squares! How come you guys get the normal ones? IS IT 'CAUSE I'M WEIRD?! IS THAT IT?!
You can do it, Notte! We believe in you! ...Er, she's going to be okay, right?
I understand your concern, but the rules clearly state that we cannot help others complete their task. We've no choice but to shout our encouragements and wait.
Though I must say, I did not expect this game to be quite so...chaotic.
Yeah, I think I'm good with spinnin' tops for the rest'a my life... Uuurgh...
Understandable, given that your lack of skill has forced you to skip your turn over and over. Thankfully, I keep landing on squares that require me to hunt fiends.
You got some good squares and some bad squares. It's the perfect party game!
Luckily, the zombies and fiends are mere illusions, so there is no actual danger. In fact, if you think of it as testing your New Year's luck, it's rather fun.
A fine way to look at it, Cleo. And with that said, it's my turn to try my luck!
Let me roll the dice... Ah, I have a four. Now I move four spaces and...
Hm? The air here feels a bit...different. That seems ominous.
Well, there's nothing for it! I'll simply have to check the square and find my next assigned task...
STOP! STOP! STOP! STOP! STOP! All players must stop everything until someone finds the lucky item!
Heavens above! What could they possibly mean by ＂lucky item＂?
So while I was being chased by a buncha dumb zombies you guys have all been stuck on this square?
Sadly, yes—and it seems we'll BE stuck here forever unless we find a ＂lucky item.＂
This damn square is huge, and it's filled with tons'a little nooks and crannies. And if that ain't enough, we don't even know what the hell we're lookin' for!
I've been trying to think about where I'd hide if I was a lucky item, but all it did was make my brain hurt.
Yeesh! If the five of you can't find it, we're in real trouble.
Or we would be, except ol' Notte happens to have a secret ace up her sleeve! ...HEY, KUZUNOHA! GET OVER HERE!
How can I help ya, pards?
You made this game, so you've gotta know how it all works, yeah? So give us a hint. Just a teeny tiny one!
We can simply ask the game's creator? I can't believe I didn't think of that...
Damn good idea, though—especially since it's Kuzunoha's fault we're all locked up in this madhouse in the first place.
Uh, right. So this is a mite embarrassin', but I actually got no idea what to do here.
But you created this game, did you not?
Well, see, that's the thing. I wanted to play it m'self, so I asked folks around Hinomoto to chip in their own puzzles— and some of 'em are real doozies!
Anyway, yer guess is as good as mine when it comes to a lot'a this stuff.
Aw, maaan! I'm gonna get old and gray and die in this place!
Don't go gettin' all pouty on me just yet! Lord Seimei's smart as a hooty owl, so I reckon he'll have an idea or three.
I do indeed have an idea or ＂three,＂ for my grandfather once told me of a similar sort of problem in a story.
Ooo, tell us! Tell us, tell us, teeell uuuus! You said you'd help, remember?
Tch. I suppose. All right, listen up, because I'm only saying this once:
This lucky item is not necessarily a thing you can hold, so perhaps you need to change how you're looking at the problem.
The heck does THAT mean?
In fact, you might be the perfect person for this particular head-scratcher, Notte.
Out of you six, what is it that only you possess?
Uh...good looks? A sparkling wit? The love and adoration of all?
*grumble* Guess those wings on her back are just for show...
Hey! I can hear you muttering over there, buddy, and I'll have ya know these wings... SWEET BABY CASSEROLE! MY WINGS!
Of course! We thought we'd looked everywhere on the ground, but I hadn't even thought of doing THAT!
Did you figure something out, Notte?
I think so. Sit tight, 'cause I'm gonna fly up for a better look. Notte...AWAAAAAY!
Okay. If this doesn't count as changing how I look at it, I don't know what... AH HA!
I knew it! There's a big picture of Shishimai on the ground here!
Well, I'll be dipped in gravy. She's right! This square's the same color as that ol' dragon's ugly mug!
The picture was so large, we never even realized it, but it looks just like him!
And considering he's known as the ＂fortune bringer,＂ I'd say that's as lucky as it gets.
Y'all nailed it like a horseshoe, 'cause the game just reacted to yer answer!
She's right! The ground just lit up, and now there's a big mark on it that says ＂Challenge Complete＂!
Thank the Goddess we can move forward! Excellent work, Notte. You were wonderful.
It really was. Your wings and brain saved the day once again.
Keep this up and my head's gonna swell up so big I'll never get outta this place! ...Er, but keep it up, okay?
But seriously, I was just happy to help— so I'm gonna keep at it and be the helpiest helper who ever helped!
Hah hah. We're counting on you, Notte! Let's have a blast with this!
You got it, bub! Now let's keep going!
Well. I'm glad I managed to make this much progress in the game...
But now I'm so far ahead, I can't see anyone else!
I mean, I knew the dice were seriously loving me today, but I never thought I'd getting THIS far out in front...
*sniff* Aw man, I hate being alone. It's all scary and junk.
Don't go worryin' yer pretty head about it, Notte! I'm right here outside the game board, and I can lend ya a hand no matter WHERE yer at!
So cheer up, buttercup! I got ya!
*sniff* Th-thanks, Kuzunoha. That makes me feel better.
Welp, even if I am by myself, time to do what I gotta do and keep pressing on.
Your girl Notte's back on her feet! Now let's roll the bones and see what kinda square I land on this—AAACK!
STOP! STOP! STOP! STOP! STOP! All players must wait here until one person clears the ＂Heart, Physique, Technique Challenge!＂
Again with these stop squares? Who spit in your breakfast cereal, ya dumb game? Also, what the heck is a ＂Heart, Physique, Technique Challenge＂?
Well, shoot! Reckon I know this one, though I coulda sworn I threw it out...
So whatcha got here are three trials that'll test the challenger's hearts, techniques, and physiques.
Wait, why is it here if you threw it out? Did your spell going all topsy-turvy send this part to Weirdsville too?
I wouldn't doubt it. And considering Kuzunoha threw it out, it must be a particularly difficult endeavor.
So what will you do, Notte? You could just wait until the rest of your team arrives.
No way! I'm gonna take on any task or trial or whatever that stands in my way!
I'm at the top of my game, and I'm gonna ace this puppy no matter HOW hard it is!
A fine attitude. Let's see what you can do.
OKAY, HOLD THE EVERYTHING! Where the heck did this cliff come from?!
The first trial measures your physique via an acrobatic rock-climbing exercise. If you reach the top, you pass.
Oh, that's it? Pfffft! Piece of cake! I've got WINGS, remember?!
Which would render this challenge utterly pointless. You might as well give up if you have so little faith in your strength.
You can't find true strength unless all three of the traits are tested—that's the central idea behind these trials.
And to that end, there is a built-in security system to ensure such cheap and tawdry tricks won't work.
NO FLYING ALLOWED! ALL CHEATERS WILL BE LAUNCHED BACK TO THE STARTING POINT WITH MY POWERFUL BEAK!
Oh man, that beak looks sharp as heck! I don't even wanna know how bad that would hurt...
If you don't want to suffer the penalty, then approach this challenge fair and square, pull on your big-girl pants, and get to climbing.
Man, you are SUCH a jerk sometimes! But fine then! If I have to do it fair and square, I'm gonna fair and square this thing right to a total win!
*gaaaaaasp* *wheeeeeze* Thought I was...gonna die...
Excellent work, Notte. You really put your back into this one.
What, was that supposed to be hard? Ha! Okay, so first trial down, right? Bring on the second one, big boy! I'm ready!
The second trial, which we call ＂Besting the Beast,＂ will measure your technique.
Uhhhh...that doesn't sound good.
Aw, it ain't so bad! Basically the game's just gonna scan yer memories and recreate a powerful enemy from yer past so ya can fight 'em again.
'Fraid I'm about as useless as two buggies in a one-horse town on this one, even if ya are just fightin' illusions of folks whatcha squared off with before.
The one who came up with this one is about as mean as Lord Seimei himself. All I can do is cheer ya on from the sidelines, but hang in there!
Sounds like Kuzunoha's already suffered a lot at the hands of this trial...
Don't worry, it's not going to kill you. Now ready yourself. And...BEGIN!
GRAAAAAAAAGH!
EEEEEEEEEEEEK!
What in tarnation is ol' Gozu doin' here?! Wait, maybe it's 'cause'a the fake one Doman went and made?
Man, they weren't kidding—this was one of our toughest fights ever! Heck, we only beat the guy by all working together, so how am I supposed to do it all by myself?!
Okay Notte, settle down. You aren't the same weak little faerie that you were all the way back when, which means...
Whoa nelly! Since when did Notte get to be so durn big?!
Time to prove just how different I am... Now behold all the skills I have now that I'm all grown-up and stuff!
GROOOOOARGH!
Yikes! His yelling made a boulder appear! ...Hey, wait. I remember this! When we broke those boulders, he got weaker!
Memories, don't fail me now! HEY, YOU! BIG FELLA! OVER HERE!
GRAAAAAGH!
GRR... GRRAAGH!
Hot dang, it worked! Now's my chance! Take the full brunt of my grown-up attacks, you big bully!
GRAAAAAARGH!
Too bad for you, bucko! I know that attack, and I know how to dodge it!
FULL-CHARGE NOTTE ATTACK IS GOOOOO!
RRAAAAARRGH!
*pant* *pant* W-well, Seimei? What'd you think of my technique?
I saw, and I am impressed. Though I'm at something of a loss to explain it, you have clearly grown—and in more than stature.
Oh, that? Yeah, I wanted to be able to protect folks, so I made myself stronger.
Anyway, we've just got the heart trial left, right? Honestly, I feel like I'm ready for whatever this stupid game throws at me!
Darn tootin'! Now keep up the good work so ya can really wow Lord Seimei!
I hope you live up to my expectations in the third and final trial.
In this one, you must overcome your fear of yourself.
What the? What's that weird haze? Whoa! Something's coming out!
Wait, is that...me? Why do I look so sad? Is THIS who I face in the third trial?
Yes. I am what you fear most in your deepest, darkest heart.
The unavoidable future where Euden and Zethia are gone and I am all alone.
Faeries live long lives, so all the people I love will leave me someday.
My future is so dark and cold... I'm so afraid of it...
No... NO, NO, NO, NOOOOO!
Stop it! Please!
I've been trying not to see that! I've been trying not to think about it! AND I DON'T WANNA SEE IT NOW!
Stop it! Please!
I've been trying not to see that! I've been trying not to think about it! AND I DON'T WANNA SEE IT NOW!
WAAAAAAAAH!
Well, heck! Notte's down there shakin' like a leaf in a stiff breeze... Lord Seimei! Lord Seimei! Something's real wrong here!
I am well aware, you stupid fox, so quit shaking me! Sadly, it seems the fear in Notte's heart was much stronger than we initially imagined.
The spell was too effective, and now she's lost the will to fight. Not a great situation.
Ya gotta save her, Lord Seimei! Ya just gotta!
Unfortunately, the spell was already concluded after her fears materialized. She is the only one who can stop it now.
This is a real dill of a pickle right here... Notte! Can ya hear me?! Don't let yerself get...uh...yerself down! You can do this!
N-no... This is impossible... I can't do it...
I've just been trying to avoid thinking about this fear, but it's true. It's all true.
No matter how long  Euden and Zethia live, it'll be the blink of an eye to me.
I'll watch them die. I'll watch ALL my friends die, and then I'll be all alone. That's my destiny for being born different from them.
You're right. It's the truth. No matter how hard I try, there's no changing it.
Or can you?
Huh?
It's true that your friends will one day pass before you, and I can only imagine the depths of grief you must be feeling.
After all, I myself was forced to face the selfsame fear once.
You were?
As you know, my grandfather was the previous Ox clan leader. Even as a small child, I had a vague image in my mind of the day he would leave me.
Although things actually ended up falling apart earlier than that thanks to Doman, but let's leave that aside.
Regardless, I was able to overcome my fears, succeed my grandfather, and break free of my cursed connection. And now, here I am.
It's difficult to completely erase one's fear of the future, but you CAN overcome it.
All you need are the fond memories of times spent with those you care about.
Will that really work?
I have so many wonderful memories of times spent with my grandfather— including how we would spend every New Year's together.
And that's why Lord Seimei's been tryin' so durn hard for y'all to have a rip-roarin' New Year—YEOWCH!
Do you EVER shut your mouth, stupid fox? Regardless, Notte, memories give people the courage it takes to live for their future.
So if you're ever afraid of what the future might hold, go make some memories that can help you overcome it.
If you just keep that frame of mind, the fears you face here today should be a simple thing to defeat.
Oh wow...
Though if you get too caught up in your memories, you'll turn into one of those idiots who can't let go of the past. Don't do that.
Use them properly to overcome your fear, and those memories will guide you to a hope that allows you to live for the future.
Hey, Seimei? Can I ask you something?
You may.
What hope did YOU find once you were all alone in the world?
The hope I'd one day become a great onmyoji like my grandfather—one worthy of being the master of both Kuzunoha and Gozu Tenno.
As well as the hope I might pass on my grandfather's teachings to them and ensure our memories are forever connected.
So your memories with your grandfather became your hope, huh? Thank you for telling me all that.
I think I have the courage to get up now.
How can you keep standing?
Isn't it obvious? I want to beat this trial and enjoy the rest of my New Year's.
That's how I'll make all sorts of wonderful memories, and I can't let something like this stop it from happening!
You say that, but it's easy to see that you're still afraid!
I'll ask again: How are you still going?
Because I love the time I spend with everyone, and I know that time is where I'll find my hope.
I won't let myself be taken out by fear, and I won't let anyone get in the way of me making memories with the people I love.
And that includes MYSELF! HAAAAAAH!
AAAHHH! Wh-what is this...? This powerful...honest...heart...
This is...the hope I have... With this...maybe someday...
Oh. She's...gone.
Which means I did it!
Ya sure did! Hoo-eee, Notte! I'm happier'n a full cow at milkin' time!
Ya got past the third trial and finished the whole durn task! Look at the ground!
The ground's glowing and there's a ＂Challenge Complete＂ stamp on it! Wooo! Yay, me! Yay, me! Yay... Huh?
Phew! We FINALLY made it...
Oh! Hey, dudes!
Notte! Thank goodness we finally caught up with you!
For real! Now let's check this square... Aw, man! It's another Stop dealie! ...Er, but wait. It's already done?
Notte, did you complete this alone?
Yep! Finished it just a second ago.
That couldn't have been easy, Notte. Nice job!
Hee hee! Yeah, I just gave it my all— plus got little bit of help from a certain somebody...
Ha! Musta been Kuzunoha, 'cause there ain't no way he woulda... Er, right?
Hee hee! It's a secret! Pretty sure the person who helped me would get all blushy about it if I told.
Anyway, let's hurry up and keep playing, 'cause I'm more excited than ever now that you're here!
I just know we can clear any challenge that comes our way!
That should do it! I think I completed the Around the World Kendama Challenge!
Ya got the ball on all the cups and the spike, so that's a big ol' win far as I'm concerned. Congrats, Cleo!
Huzzah! Now to move three squares.
We're close as heck now! I know one of us is gonna reach the end here soon!
Yeah, we only have about ten spaces to go until the end. But before that...
AAAUGH! Not another Stop square!
It sounds like the last trial is waiting, so let's get going!
We managed to make it this far, but...
BRAAAAAINS...
Those zombies are blocking our path! And though I know they aren't real, there are still enough of them to send chills up my spine.
Don't help that I can't make heads or tails of this challenge.
＂Protect the most important thing＂? I fear I also do not understand this. What exactly are we to be protecting?
Is this another one of those Hinomotoan riddles? 'Cause if so, we might not wanna be randomly attacking any zombies.
That's certainly possible. Best to figure out the puzzle before we try anything.
But with instructions so vague, how are we meant to solve it?
Don't worry, dudes. I've got this.
You do?
Mmm-hmm! Knowing what the creators of this sugoroku wanted their players to experience, I'm certain I have the answer.
The most important thing to me is making lots of happy memories with all of you— and I won't EVER question that again.
But if I'm gonna protect that, I've gotta take out any obstacles that stand in the way of making more memories!
So watch out, zombies, 'cause you're all in for a major butt-kicking!
GRAAAAAAAAAAGH!
Holy cripes! Notte just charged into that horde'a zombies all by herself!
She normally would have been terrified...
She's like a new person. Something must have happened when we were separated.
And if that's the case, I want to believe in the answer she's found.
Pretty sure all of us feel the same, so we better hustle if we don't wanna miss out!
YEAH!
Hey! Save a zombie for me, lady!
After all, it's much more enjoyable to make memories together than to do so by yourself. Right, Notte?
Aw, thanks, guys!  With all of us, this'll be done in no time!
GRAAGH!
Eeek! I'm surrounded!
CLEO!
GET AWAY FROM MY FRIEND, JERK! I'M GONNA PROTECT 'EM ALL!
FAERIEEEE PUNISHMEEEENT!
Uuuuurgh...
We did it! We defeated the zombies! Is the challenge complete now?
Well, the ground just lit up and there's a Challenge Complete stamp on it, sooo...
Sure as shootin', pards! Y'all just beat the last challenge, and it's a straight shot to the finish line!
WOOOO! Let's book it, guys!
BLARGH! Ow, ow, ow... Oh, hey! I think we're home.
It feels like it's been ages since we last set foot in the Halidom.
That sugoroku was fun, but it also kinda messed me up in a whole lot of ways. I'm gonna go sleep for a year. Peace.
Do not even think about it, Luca! I understand you must be worn out, but I will not have you sleeping on our freshly cleaned floor.
Well, I'm just pleased as all get-out that y'all made it back in one piece.
I'm real shamed to have put ya in such a sorry situation, but at least it's over.
I also apologize for my fool of a shikigami having put you through such an ordeal.
So then? What did you think of the real-life sugoroku?
If I'm bein' honest...
Augh! I can't take the suspense!
IT WAS SOOO HARD! It's definitely the most exciting thing we've done for New Year's, and I'm super-duper glad we tried it.
But that being said, maybe it'd be better if New Year's is a more peaceful celebration after all...
New Year's celebrations ARE meant to be a time where one prays for a peaceful year, I suppose.
But if you want to know if I had fun or not, the answer is yes!
So much happened, and I made all kinds of memories that I'll never forget!
Well, I'm happier'n a pig in the sun to hear that. If ya ask me, the more happy memories ya make, the better!
And it was your game that helped me realize that, so I guess we BOTH win!
Thanks, Kuzunoha—and you too, Seimei!
Aw, shucks. It ain't no big deal.
I didn't really do much. But if you truly mean all that, you'd better get on and enjoy the rest of your New Year's party.
I'm sure you have many more New Year's memories to make, after all.
Oh yeah! I'm gonna make so many that they start spillin' out my ears!
And if you guys are here with us, we'll be able to enjoy the holiday even more!
Y'all can count on me, 'cause I got a heap'a fun spells ready for this shindig!
Uh...are you sure about that? I mean, the last spell sorta became A Thing, yeah?
Oh, I'm not about to let that happen again; I did a thorough check of everything else while you were off in the game world.
Well, if Seimei says it's safe, then... HEY, GUYS!
We've got more New Year's festivities with Seimei's seal of approval, so let's try 'em out after we finish eating!
I'm up for it! New Year's has only just begun, after all.
Eeexactly! I'm gonna do all kinds of new and exciting stuff with you this year—and that's a promise, Euden!
